content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-132-06-A
|Item_parent=Cognitive disorders in the elderly. (see item 108)
|Item_parent_short=Cognitive disorders in the elderly. (see item 108)
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the main causes of a neuro-cognitive disorder.
|Description=None
|Rubric=Etiologies
|Contributors=
|Order=6}}
According to the DSM 5, the possible etiologies of major or mild neurocognitive disorders are :


Alzheimer's disease,

Frontotemporal degeneration

Lewy body disease

Neurovascular encephalopathy

Secondary to cerebral trauma

Secondary to substance use

Secondary to HIV infection

Parkinson's disease

Prion disease

Huntington's disease

Multiple etiologies

question.title: What are the possible etiologies of major or mild neurocognitive disorders according to the DSM 5?

option_a.title: Alzheimer's disease and Frontotemporal degeneration
option_a.description: Two of the possible etiologies of neurocognitive disorders

option_b.title: Alzheimer's disease, Lewy body disease, and Parkinson's disease
option_b.description: Three of the possible etiologies of neurocognitive disorders

option_c.title: Alzheimer's disease, Lewy body disease, and Prion disease
option_c.description: Three of the possible etiologies of neurocognitive disorders

option_d.title: Alzheimer's disease, Lewy body disease, and Multiple etiologies
option_d.description: Two of the possible etiologies of neurocognitive disorders
